title: Secretary III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: In my opinion I think It was longer than it needed to be . I think HR worked slow. It was a prescreen, then 2 interviews and typing test ( if you don’t pass, you are not offered the job).
Interview Questions: Behavior based and situational based combined.

title: Information Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Scenario questions and questions about yourself. It’s a great experience, the managers are the sweetest. It’s pretty easy just bring examples from past work experiences. Great overall job, nice environment.
Interview Questions: What do you enjoy during free time ?

title: Technical Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: The first step in the process was a phone call. They asked simple questions about myself and my experience. In the second step, there was an in-person interview. This interview lasted 30 minutes and they asked more questions about myself.
Interview Questions: How would I describe myself

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: I recently had a Zoom interview with two very friendly interviewers, who made the experience comfortable and casual. The questions asked were straightforward and easy to answer. I am excited to share that I have been offered a position for summer 2023 and have accepted the offer with great pleasure.
Interview Questions: Are you a patient person?

title: Business Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone call interview which went smoothly where I talked minimally about my past experience and a situational question. The follow up call was with the supervisor I would be working under.
Interview Questions: What was your experience like working in ___

title: Software Engineer, Backend Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Temple University in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: I got an offer for a screening interview via zoom within a week of submitting my application. The interviewers seemed disinterested, and I found one of them to be rather condescending. They said they would update me on the application progress within a week or two, but I never received any notice.
Interview Questions: With your educational background, how did you convince your current employer to hire you?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews, 2nd interview had multiple parties involved and one interviewer was not paying attention at all and kept losing his place in the meeting and asked same questions because they weren't paying attention. After three interviews and making to final round, I did not hear back ever again. No rejection email. Nothing.
Interview Questions: Seemed more interested in putting down my current place of employment than asking about how my work would serve the job I was interviewing for.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: The process was: 15 minute phone screen then in-person and virtual meeting with manager, then a group presentation and finally team interviews. It took some time to get a final offer due to reference checks and background check process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? Why this particular role?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: I received the internship through word of mouth, but the preliminary interview process went very smooth. My supervisors and mentors were all very friendly, and I felt appreciated and listened to.
Interview Questions: What is your prior experience? What makes you a good fit for this specific college?

title: Student Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a comfortable and informational interview that allowed them to get to know me as well as me get to know them. It wasn't too difficult and I got to discuss all that I have learned in my college classes that fit the job position criteria.
Interview Questions: What have you learned in your college classes that fit being a graphic designer?

title: Real Estate Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: The interview went well, but it has been over a month and nobody has given me any news. I understand that there are plenty of candidates, but I advise to interview once they are ready to hire.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were about my background in real estate and what kind of projects I have done.

title: Graduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty straight forward and easy going. Tested my technical knowledge based on my coursework and asked me why I was interested in joining the research and what I could contribute.
Interview Questions: why I was interested in joining the research?

title: Tech Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Very chill, just have your  resume ready, 1 interview process. Very quick turnaround for decision. Mark interviewed me and was very nice and  communicated the expectations of the position well
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for this position?

title: Web Developer Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Easy to schedule an interview. Very friendly and understanding. Just Prepare for basic interview questions and you should be fine. Had to demo a website that I created to show them my understanding.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals?

title: Software Development Engineer (SDE1) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions:
Coding and behavior, three rounds.Contact by HR after 1 week submit resume

Why you want to join us, and why we should choose you
what do you do when encounter difficulties at work
Interview Questions:
Why you want to join us, and why we should choose you
what do you do when encounter difficulties at work

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Interviews are conducted by each team. My first interview was a phone screening with the hiring manager, my second one was back-to-back in person interviews with different members of the team
Interview Questions: How my experience transfers to this role. What it means to work as a team.

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Temple University in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: I feel that Temple overall lacks a seamless interview process. The online application process is fine, the problem is the lack of communication during the interview process. You wouldn’t know if you got the job or not for weeks or months simply because someone in HR didn’t do their jobs fast enough. Even a simple “you’re welcome” to a thank-you email goes a long way. Because it is an established institution, they seem to forget that the candidates are interviewing them as well. This may be the reason why they have issues with external hires and often have to rely on less qualified internal employees to fill positions.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had a challenge completing a project.

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: The process was quite clear. They are interested in people skills and working with a team. Public speaking skills are necessary as well, along with ability to answer questions on the spot from prospective students.
Interview Questions: Do you like to work with a team?

title: Reseach Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: onsite visit and talk about your future goal and career goal, life style, work style,  fav rate phila delphia pa, view and other things, benefit, 1 day visit,m meet different people
Interview Questions: few questions about past exp

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy process but you have to have a good network. I got the internship from knowing someone that recommend me to the hiring manager. From there, the interview process was quick. I had about a 40 minutes interview.
Interview Questions: - Tell about yourself - What are your past experiences

title: Trauma Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very friendly and the staff communicated well. They were flexible with various interview options. The team seemed to really take the time to read my resume before we met which was nice.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working in an inner city school?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
30 minutes zoom interview. Asking questions on course development. They gave time for questions at the end. They are telling about the campus and opportunities during the interview. 
30 minutes zoom interview. Asking questions on course development. They gave time for questions at the end. They are telling about the campus and opportunities during the interview.
Interview Questions: Course information- building a syllabus

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was very easy. I was called within 10 days of applying. First interview was with 6 folks at once. I appreciated that over answering the same questions 6 times. My second interview was scheduled the same day as the first and took place the following day. It was another two weeks before I had the official offer. I think this would normally come more quickly, but the HR rep for my position was on vacation, so the communication was delayed.

The interview experience will probably vary widely depending on the department your apply to. For me it was really simple.
Interview Questions: Why do your want to work at temple?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly straightforward. I had several interviewers throughout the day. They asked fairly standard interview questions. I felt like they really tried to get to know and understand me.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Human Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The questions they asked didn’t seem completely in line with the description of the position.  They seemed nice but like they did not have strong internal communication. 2 of the people had 1 understanding of the position and the other 2 had a different understanding. Honestly they questions felt like I was interviewing for 2 different roles. 
The interview was on zoom, and was surprisingly more formal than what a lot of modern interviews are
Interview Questions: What does this job title mean to you…explain what you think it means

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions about strengths, weaknesses, working with difficult team members and how you got through it, leadership qualities. A verbal skills checklist and then perform steps of primary assessment and cpr
Interview Questions: The 5 reasons you stop cpr

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Fun cool and exciting. They asked me what do I think about research I said it’s very important. They said you will do great I said thanks for the opportunity.
Interview Questions: What is your previous experience doing this?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: It wasn't that bad. They asked basic questions like strengths and weaknesses, introducing yourself, why do you want to work with them. They are understanding too, and easy-going. If you are a student looking for a work-study job, they are most likely to hire you.
Interview Questions: So tell me about yourself?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was in-person interview the usual question was asked. They took the time to listen to what I had to say. My nerves gave in. I was a mess but they still gave me a second interview and it went much better.
Interview Questions: What are my weaknesses and strength?

title: ESL Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Temple University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I went on two interviews. They seemed friendly. It did, however, take them two months to set up and interview. They asked general questions and wanted me to prepare a lesson plans.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between working with children and adults.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process at Temple University was easy and casual although a bit convoluted when it came to drug testing. I didn't mind it although it could have resulted in more transparency at what a day in the life is like.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions for the team

title: Student Athletic Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: It went well. Nice people. A very positive atmosphere. Football was the sport of choice. The team was very accepting. Schedule was made to help balance school and work. Thank you Temple University
Interview Questions: Prior experience in the field.

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: I was invited for an in-person campus visit, which lasted from about 9am to about 4:30pm. The interview began with a teaching demonstration and was followed by a series of meetings with different groups of people (the search committee, other librarians) and ended with several one-on-one interviews.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. Simple questions like why do you wanna work here and why are you a good fit. Interviewer is very laid back and the conversation was easy. A very great place to work and very convenient on campus location. Flexible job
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Took a bit for them to contact with an interview, but they were prompt with scheduling.  I did move further in the process, the job wasn't for me.  I would apply again for a position.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position.

title: HR Generalist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: There was one phone screen and a total of two in-person interviews conducted with a team comprised of potential co-workers, and the hiring manager.  Interviews were spaced out over the course of about one month.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Sales Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Initial Virtual Process, waited a couple of weeks for confirmation. Was a one-way interview. Greeted with a video from their HR department featuring campus events and their CFO and Provost.
Interview Questions: How do you ensure that your efforts have a positive impact on the students who attend this university?

title: Desktop Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Several technical questions, general review of overall working background, a light demonstration of technical experience. Straightforward and pleasant, short meeting with HR and working team. Very transparent about expected pay and benefits included.
Interview Questions: What is a solid state drive, how does it differ from other storage devices?

title: Diamond Peer Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy online application. just needed a sponsor from a faculty member to recommend and help with in the following semester. Not stressful at all which is great for students
Interview Questions: no questions were asked for this

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and then in person interview, it was very pleasant experience, nothing was too difficult and the questions were straightforward. During the phone interview it was more information about the position and then in person was more scenario based.
Interview Questions: How previous experience could benefit me here

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: The interview went smoothly, all faculty and staff were kind and helpful in navigating the process and making me feel comfortable. I was very impressed with the environment around campus.
Interview Questions: What is your experience level?

title: Graduate Assistant Non Teaching Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: The GA interview for a non-teaching position was thoughtful, well-balanced and allowed me to express my ambitions for garnering a GA position in my field of study. It allowed me the opportunity to not only get a feel for real world interviews but also clinical pathways and how they intermix with education.
Interview Questions: What do you feel you deserve this position?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Review of my credentials and what they want in a student worker. We talked about how my past experiance can help them as well as the time span I will be able to obatian this job.
Interview Questions: How does you past experience help with this position?

title: Bibliographic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward three step process. Met with supervisor, head of dpt, & library administration. Took 2 hours in total. Questions straight forward and no curve balls, what you’d imagine it is.
Interview Questions: Give me a time you had to take responsibility?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Multiple rounds of in person and zoom interviews with increasing difficulty. During COVID 19 pandemic everything was online through zoom and ambassadors did virtual tours lasting about 1-2 hours. Overall the interview process was very good and the workers were very understanding.
Interview Questions: Why did you want to be a tour guide for Temple?

title: Executive Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Initial additional questions after resume submission. 2  separate zoom meetings  with total 4 people.  Good communication for about a week after, then nothing. Courtesy of moving forward or not would have been appropriate.
Interview Questions: Tell us more about you.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: One interview with Manager and future Co Worker to decide my fit for the role. Hit it off with the other student so the interview was a breeze! Jobs are few and far between now because of the pandemic.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations?

title: Standardized Patient Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Super uncomfortable and awkward. Was in a tiny room, made to feel small. There was just something off about the whole experience. The feeling about the place and the work atmosphere seemed toxic and I would not recommend.
Interview Questions: Typical standardized exam simulation experience

title: Fox Av Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: They called me in very quickly. There was almost no waiting time to hear back from them. The interview was super easy, friendly, and professional. They let you know right away whether you will be hired or not.
Interview Questions: how do you deal w stressful situations

title: Virtual Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a Zoom call with the boss who explained to me the purpose of the job and what I would be doing. He was super interested in me and my qualifications. After the interview I went through a practice day to see what the job would be like.
Interview Questions: Why are you qualified to be a Zoom assistant?

title: Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with about 10 other applicants. Interviewer asked us to introduce ourselves, then asked a series of questions for which anyone could raise their hand to answer, if they so choose. Later, interviewees were allowed to ask questions.
Interview Questions: What qualities do you have that would make you a good peer mentor?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was in person and was in front of a small panel that reviewed my resume and past experience.  The panel also conducted the interview in a very formal way.
Interview Questions: Can you fully commit to all the tasks that are required for this job?

title: Grounds Crew Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Just asked me a few questions, very easy.  I found out about the job by talking to others who had already worked there, so I was familiar with the process.  If you have any prior experience doing landscaping or cutting grass, that is a really big plus.
Interview Questions: Do you have a drivers license?

title: Ph.D. Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Received zoom interview in early January and set up a half-hour zoom meeting. Only one interviewer showed up during the process. Not sure if the interview was recorded. Received the offer letter about two weeks later.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to pursue a Ph.D. degree?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was short, comprised of asking a couple questions about yourself and why you applied to the job. The last portion was doing a demo of teaching a problem of your choice from a sheet of questions.
Interview Questions: What made you want to apply to this job?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: First was a techinical round with basic questions. Second was more like a discussion on the expectations at work.First was a techinical round with basic questions. Second was more like a discussion on the expectations at work.
Interview Questions: Experience using Excel

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview first and an in-person interview second. The in-person interview was almost 2 hours long.  It was a little awkward because there was another candidate sitting in  the lobby waiting to be interviewed for the same position.
Interview Questions: Why Temple?

title: Digital Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very awkward and off putting. Completely changed my opinion about the organization. Disappointing, interviewer seemed uninformed and hostile.  Not inclined to interview with organization in the future.  Interview experience was terrible.
Interview Questions: How to deal with difficult stakeholders.

title: Policy Analyst, Hope Center Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Demanded an onerous work sample before even doing a phone screen or sharing the salary range. This is widely recognized as a poor process -- Ask A Manager has an entire post on it.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took quite a while. There was a long gap between my initial phone interview and my in-person interview. The interview was standard, the people who interviewed me were very nice and asked relatively standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: What sets you apart from other candidates/what doesn't your resume say about you that we should know?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: it was easy. Regular questions about my experience and degree. they asked about my degree and job experience. My supervisor was vary nice and easy process. she hired me right away.
Interview Questions: tell me about your self

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Got an interview. Guy asked questions on my experience and how I tutor. I was asked the usual questions. Nothing hard. Interviewer asked me to show him how to do a math problem.
Interview Questions: Past experience?

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed. Was interview by two people, and one of them was a current student working there. It was also pretty short. I was a summer hire so it can be different when they hire during the semesters. During the semesters, they conduct interviews in groups.
Interview Questions: Had me do a powerpoint explaining why I want this position.

title: Writing Center Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: With my invitation to interview, I was sent a sample student essay to look over and provide feedback on in the interview. In the interview itself, I met with two supervisors. They asked questions about my experience and my writing process, and a significant portion of the interview focused on my feedback on the sample essay. It was a pleasant, warm, and professional encounter.
Interview Questions: How would you structure a session with the student who wrote this essay?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was short and simple. There were two people conducting the interview, one being the supervisor, and the other a student worker at the office. I was brought into a conference room where they asked around 10 personal questions.
Interview Questions: Have you ever faced a challenge and how did you overcome it?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: I participated in one phone interview  with just one person and then in person interview was an all day process meeting with groups of related staff within the department who the role would be working with.
Interview Questions: Asked for strengths

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Over email (as I was out of the country and could not come in), it was a simple and easy process. She asked the questions she would have asked me if I could come in and I sent back my responses. The next email was an offer and asking what days/hours I could work.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in the Athletics Department?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the TU portal, careers @ temple section. I submitted a resume and cover letter and got an email from a director that wants to schedule an interview. She needed one follow up email and that was it.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable talking to new people?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was brought in for an interview. People are very friendly! Questions weren't hard and can be expected. Interviewers wanted to get to know you and weren't intimidating at all. They also told you what they expected from you and asked you about your expectations for them.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. We received emails about the available positions, then I applied for two of them, in a week or so I received an email saying I got the position.
Interview Questions: no question were asked !

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied in late November, and was contacted for a phone interview in mid-December. I had the phone interview in late December, followed by 3 in-person interviews in early January, and received the official offer for the position a couple weeks later.
Interview Questions: How would you handle prioritizing various tasks of equal importance?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: There is both a group interview and a individual. During the group there were two interviewers.  Some received phone interviews. During individual there were more interviewers.  Questions were not always direct and were indirect towards the job.
Interview Questions: What's your greatest weakness?

title: Technical Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and straightforward however slow. Once I got a call decision was made fairly quickly. One thing I do not like however is they never keep you updated in the process.
Interview Questions: What is an SSD

title: Animal Caretaker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was an in person interview with me, the hiring manager and one other person.  They had a list of questions and wrote down answers to the questions as I answered.  They asked me elaborate about items listed on my resume and related those things to the position I was interviewing for.  The hiring manager went into a deeper explanation of the position and then  gave me the opportunity to ask questions.
Interview Questions: They asked standard interview questions such as what are your greatest strengths, what are your weaknesses, why do you want this position. Also because it was an animal caretaker position they asked which animals I preferred working with and why.

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: No interviewing process. A professor at Temple asked me if I would be interested in becoming a teaching assistant for them. I accepted and filled out the HR paperwork.  And that was it.
Interview Questions: There were no questions asked.

title: Account Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Arrived, sat down with several HR people, they went over my Resume and asked question about each specific item. The women in HR did not give any insight into why they were asking relatively inane questions. I left and have not heard back since
Interview Questions: Where is your happy place?

title: International Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was first invited for a phone interview, but because I was abroad they chose to have a Skype video interview. Next round was with a panel of 5 people and I was asked to prepare a 5-minute presentation about Temple. The next week they asked for my references. They spoke to 2 out of 3 of them. About one month passed and I hadn't heard anything, so I reached out to the hiring manager. She responded almost immediately thanking me for my patience. Another month later I emailed again with no response. HR never even sent me an automated email saying they had hired someone else.
Interview Questions:
1. Tell me about yourself.
2. How do you build rapport with students?
3. What social media platforms are you comfortable with and how would you utilize them in working with international students?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: One super day interview. Meet with faculty and members of the college. Have a presentation and interview. The interview focuses on instructional skills and also research skills depend on the position you applied for.
Interview Questions: How do you handle constructive criticism?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Met directly with hiring manager of laboratory, discussed goals in science and previous experience. I had the skills needed so we started talking about the project at hand. It really was a simple interview, but this may vary among labs as every PI is their own hiring manager.
Interview Questions: What previous experiences in cell culture do you have?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: As long as you have a strong related background, it should be OK.  The most important is to contact professors before applying. The GPAs, English, and other documents are not that important.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to apply for this position?
Ask students some related knowledge

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Temple University (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was okay, the interviewers we supportive and helped me understand the problems. I felt comforted and challenged, so overall it was a good experience. Though personality side could have been better.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 4 years?

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was the same process as a full time faculty position. Two days of interviewing, presentations, and dinners. I spoke with almost every faculty member in the the department in rapid back to back interviews.
Interview Questions: Presentation on recent research work

title: MBA Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Go to Alter Hall for in person interview. Ask basic questions like short term and long term goal. Also ask why Fox school of business and why MBA. Very friendly and very comfortable. Good interview experience.
Interview Questions: short term and long term goal, why fox and why MBA

title: Assistant Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly staff. The interview process is very fair but might get lengthy because of HR. The neighborhood is not good.  It is close to public transport. Overall it was a good experience
Interview Questions: General questions about the project

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Temple University in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Speak to the professor after you've taken a class and gotten a B+ or higher, the professor may or may not ask for an interview depending on how active you were during your class.
Interview Questions: Reviewing class material

title: Senior Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Approx 1 Week after applying on Temple website, I was contacted to schedule a phone interview with the staff. The phone interview was really positive and got schedule for a face to face interview a week later. Also the face to face interview was really good, the staff who interviewed was really nice and made me feel comfortable. 5 Days after face to face interview they asked me for 3 professional references. 2 weeks later got the job offer, which I accepted. In overall it took approx 1 month from applying to getting the offer. I was a very nice experience.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking for a change?

title: Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: You have a phone interview first, then if they like you will invite for in person interview, which is really detailed. They ask about your background, experience and the level of knowledge on some areas
Interview Questions: Why are you looking to leave your current company?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Temple University in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is so long and has no real defined process or follow-through. It was long, there were periods of 0 communication to the point I didn't know if I was even still interviewing.
Interview Questions: They asked questions all over the place, some of which didn't even apply to the job I was interviewing for.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Online application. I started at Temple as a PhD student . I had applied online from abroad and never had to go through the interview. For PhD student you need no interview. After I finished my PhD my advisor offered a Research Assistant position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: It took a month but the interview itself took 30 minutes. The interview asked mostly behavioral questions and was very focused on what was the right thing.  The interview itself was very easy but getting it was the hardest part.
Interview Questions: When was a time where you had to be the leader of something?

title: Associate Director of Marketing and Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions:
Applied through Glassdoor. Standard interview process was an initial phone screen was set up and about a week later an in person interview was conducted. They had me review several documents and website to provide insight and recommendations on how they could improve their operations. Naturally I spent hours preparing myself for the interview. When the day of the interview came, I thought I impressed my potential superiors who conducted the rounds of questions.   At the end of the interview they told me  they should be wrapping up the interviews in the next couple days. I followed back up accordingly several times with several different people and they all ignored my emails and calls. 

EXTREMELY UNPROFESSIONAL!!! Although I thought I was a strong candidate for the role, I understand there can always be someone else more qualified. What I  cannot understand is the lack of communication especially when they know you're taking PTO and requiring candidates to perform in depth research for the interview. How long does it take to email someone back and tell them they are not the candidate they selected?
Interview Questions: Did you take a look at our websites? What would you change?

title: Head Football Equipment Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Meet with the head coach, Asst. AD and a few others.  Was shown around the facility and was told what as expected of me. Was introduced to staff and players.
Interview Questions: What are your values

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Temple University in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was pretty straightforward, a lot of basic knowledge of troubleshooting with computer. The hiring manager has a positive vibe. There was also an additional student worker who will ask you questions in regards to this position but overall the interview process is easy.
Interview Questions: When a PC has a black screen what are some of the trouble shooting steps you take

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard, I went through the phone interview and in-person interview process.  The best part about working at Temple in being right in the city.  Depending on what department you work with you will most likely get a (small) tour of the city on your interview and it can give you a really good feel for Philadelphia before you commit to anything.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your previous experience working with student athletes.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was very impressed with the hiring process. Upon my initial posting for the job I heard within 2 weeks unlike my current employer. Great interview process. I will continue to apply for a jobs at Temple.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself going within the next couple of years.?

title: Computer Lab Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: It's a work study job. There was no interview for this job. All I had to do is apply for this position, and if there a open position they will hire you.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Resume screening without interview. GPA, GRE and Tofel scores are required. The interview process is slow. It might changed now. Typically there might be a phone interview to test your communicate skills.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was casual and lacked professionalism. The questions were not in allignment with ths job description. they took a long timd to get back with the results almost a month and half.
Interview Questions: Talk about your previous experience

title: Class Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Media, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone call interview asking about past experiences. The interviewer was very nice and talked about my responsibilities moving forward and how I would be working. Would recommend to anyone looking for a role in this field
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: There is an A and B round, first eliminating by GPA and then by an in person interview.  Overall the process is not too rigorous but GPA is a very important factor in differentiating candidates.
Interview Questions: How do you see research affecting your future goals.

title: Library Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening, then follow up in person with developers, librarians, Dean, and HR.  All seemed great until HR mentioned, after all interviews, there'd be drug screening.  Ridiculous in 2017 for a developer, but something you've got to consider when applying to larger institutions.
Interview Questions: What's your development environment look like?

title: Senior Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was in-person interview and group interview. It took 4 weeks process and background check. It asked three people reference. The first day was for orientation and was 15 people in same date.
Interview Questions: Ask some questions about sql questions

title: Research Analyst I Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a phone interview followed by an on-sight interview where the first half hour was an informal meeting with the direct supervisor, than about 3 hours where I met with all the different leaders within the department and with my future direct team members. Everyone was very nice, interviewing is always nerve-wracking but the process was good.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here, why do you think you're a good fit, pretty simple questions

title: Computer Lab Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Just coming in for a meeting in person to talk about what they would do as a worker at temple. Asking simple questions like if I would can handle the responsibilities fixing printers, fax machine, filling paper and changing ink.
Interview Questions: How many hours can i work lol

title: Volunteer Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Asked the Professor about researching in his lab, looked at my transcripts and asked me a few questions about my course work and let me volunteer. that was it
Interview Questions: What courses have you taken?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview, and a follow up in person interview. Both interviews were to gather more information on my background and if I was a fit for this position. Overall the process was good and I was offered a position
Interview Questions: What is my background?

title: Tech Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with 3 supervisors, each working in a specific area. Each of them asked me about my background and what do I know about science and business. Nothing specific! They also asked about my availability
Interview Questions: What is your background?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview is pretty straight forward. You are asked about your previous experiences, and discuss what you can add to the new project. You then meet with the other lab member and discuss in further details about the projects that are ongoing in the lab and once again, about your previous experience and how you could use your past skills and apply them to the new lab
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very short, quick and to the point. Was asked a few questions about my background and how it would help me to perform the job well. Was given a description of the job as well. Was offered a position less than a week later.
Interview Questions: What job tasks have you done in the past that would help you in this position?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume via email to who ever needed a student worker. You have to apply through the owl network job searching portal. Once selected you will gave one phone interview with the manager. After that you will have an in person interview before getting an offer.  The interview process was easy. They usually are looking for people that can fit their schedule along side with your school schedule.
Interview Questions: What is your class schedule?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied through HR website and was contacted about 10 days later by a senior in Admissions. Scheduled an interview for 5 days later. Interview consisted of a 10-minute presentation and a Q&A portion with 4 senior administrators. About a week later, I was asked to submit my reference list. Another week went by and I was offered the position after background checks.
Interview Questions: What are some traits your co-workers would describe about you?

title: Circulation Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with the managers and we had a 30 minute interview. They were nice and open and asked great personal questions. They inquired a lot about my past work experiences and tons of scenario questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time that you had to deal a annoying patron.

title: Assistant Director of Digital Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I am an Alumni and I received a call from a lovely assistant to set up an interview, the earliest slot was a few weeks later. I met with two directors, the questions weren't too difficult and they mostly just asked questions about my previous position. They said they would let me know at the beginning of the following month. That week came and went and I sent a follow up the next week when I still hadn't heard back, but received no response. A few weeks later my application status changed on the HR site to "no longer being considered" and I just happened to check the site again to see it. I was pretty turned off by the lack of communication as a human and as a proud Alumni. Hopefully this is isolated to that department.
Interview Questions: Why this position, why Temple?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview. They asked me about my experience and went in depth about the position. They wanted to know about my experience and how it was relevant to the position I was applying for.
Interview Questions: Experience related to position.

title: Office Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions:
Open to students freshmen - senior 
Brief 
Asked about previous experience working in office departments 
Asked about Microsoft Word, Excel
Stressed organizational and communication skills
Eligible for Work Study
Described duties of position such as distributing mail, helping with attendance, and office filing.
Interview Questions: Questions pertaining to communication skills & office work

title: Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was asked the typical questions given at an interview. Was a very positive expericance and I felt as though they wanted me to succed and d well. Very nice interview
Interview Questions: When is one time you failed at something

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: I did not have any interview. I started here when I was a graduate students. They did not have funding to support me as a teaching assistant; so, they offered me an adjunct position instead.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received an email for an interview via call, and then was invited to campus for an in person interview.  The job description did not match what they were looking for at all.  I never heard from them about whether or not I got the job and my job profile is still in "Interview" status 3 months later.  Horrible, unprofessional experience.
Interview Questions: Positive and negatives to advising MBA students

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was short and to the point. The interviewers were obviously in need of someone toil the role, it was decided by the end of the interview that I had the job.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths?
Would you say you're a team player?
Describe a time when you had to solve a problem without the help of your supervisor.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was e-mailed for an interview within a few weeks. The interview was for a new position so the entire application process was relatively vague. The interview was a group/panel interview where I was asked several questions from different heads of various departments. They mostly wanted to know about my previous work experience and what I could bring to this new position. They spent a decent amount of time explaining the background of the university and
Interview Questions: No questions were completely unexpected. They wanted to know about my previous experience and what I could bring to this new position.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I think it varies from department to department, but most people are looking for whether or not you're a good fit for higher ed.    You will also meet with a few different people, not just your supervisor.
Interview Questions: General questions about your skillset and whether or not you have experience in higher ed.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: I applied only via mail and did not have a scheduled interview. Thus, I simply applied via mail and received an answer a few months later that I was accepted.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: BI Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: First with director then manager then team.  Basically to see if my credentials met the requirement and personality with the team.  The director called the staffing agency who then called me..I started the following Monday and when I went in all y credentials were ready for me..First with director then manager then team.  Basically to see if my credentials met the requirement and personality with the team.  The director called the staffing agency who then called me..I started the following Monday and when I went in all y credentials were ready for me
Interview Questions: How to troubleshoot an issue with a report

title: Student STEM Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Came  into the office for placement exam. Was basically offered the job off of the strength of my character and as a method of playing for final classes. No real interview but this doesn't mean slack. Professionalism is still the preference. Employer saw the need for more help in the STEM community and therefore decided to help. Truly grateful for the opportunity and the experience.
Interview Questions: How do you like your current employer

title: Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: The interview included describing customer service experience and what you know about sound and lighting systems. Very nice interviewer and building manager were asking the questions. I was not unfamiliar with the cords such as xlr's and HDMI cords that you use on the job.
Interview Questions: How would you enforce such and such policy

title: Student Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Met with two supervisors to discuss position and my own background. It was at first a little intimidating, but overall fine. About three weeks later I had a phone interview with an additional employee.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview consists of giving a research talk, meeting with the dean and vice dean, and having a 2-hour meeting with the whole department. Everyone was friendly and they didn't seem to be "out to get you" and didn't ask any stressful questions. Mainly have you talk about your research, about the classes you've taught, about future research plans, etc.
Interview Questions: If you could choose one class to teach, what would it be?

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with three people asking questions. Very standard interview questions. In addition, they call about three references and another three references have to fill out something online for you.
Interview Questions: How has your experience prepared you for this position?

title: Graduate Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview went well. I had only only interview but the decision time that they took was long. I was told that the decision will be made in a week but it was made in 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online and was contacted about a week later to set up an interview which took place on campus.  Very straightforward, and I was only interviewed by one person.  Only took about 15 minutes give or take.  My interviewer was very friendly and answered all of my questions.  I was also introduced to the other staff members I'd be working with if I got the job.  They were very nice as well.
Interview Questions: There weren't really any difficult or unexpected questions-pretty standard stuff.

title: Graphic Design Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was straight forward and helpful. I think the people there want to help students out since this job is more for student workers.  The supervisors were great during the interview making me feel comfortable and they told me exactly what was expected for the job.
Interview Questions: They asked if I could work more hours than I had planned to.

title: Student Worker Postion Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Simple and informal. Would recommend asking the HR or hiring manager directly rather than using the website. Found that people are more receptive to students asking about employment opportunities than the site, which is often inaccurate and post expired information. Be careful about where you go, certain buildings are looking to hire from within the student pool of the school they are affiliated with. AKA Fox and Boyer.
Interview Questions: Q: Do you have a good record of previous employment?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was long and extensive. I applied for the position in February and did not get an email regarding interest to interview until April. Then I didn't get to interview until May because the Project Manager did not start until then.  As far as the interview, I led the conversation during the process. Not many questions were asked of me, but I prepared a few for them regarding the study in advance.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself that is not on your resume?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Just one round of interviews with the to-be direct supervisor and his/her boss. Following that they asked for references and offered the job. This process did take awhile though. Took about a month from the interview to get the offer. For awhile I thought I didn't get it. I learned from working there that this slow turn around was the way everything was for the specific Office I worked in.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online about ~2 weeks later got an email from a professor Rabinowitz to come in.

Interview was very awkward - this was a 4.5 hr drive for me one way and he had no questions prepared for me. I asked varying questions about the research and also how the lab was run. Got a tour of the lab facilities. 

Very unprofessional, did not contact me at all after. I found out the position had been closed by checking online.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Video Equipment Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: All communications in the hiring process were done via email. You will work with HR, not the person interviewing or ultimately, supervising you. Ask for more money when you start. They may not be able to budge, but it's your best shot of earning more. Also, don't expect quick turnaround times.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Executive Assistant/Senior Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by five senior managers, each of whom had conflicting agendas about the position's essential functions and to whom the new hire would report.  The position for which I was interviewed was "Assistant Director of Development."  I was asked if I would accept another title at the same grade level until HR approved the creation of this new position.
Interview Questions: It was clear that the five individuals had not met before the interview because the individual interests and ideas were competing with the others.  When there were too many uncomfortable silences, I performed the interview that was well-rehearsed.

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume and cover letter online.  the following week i had a phone interview.  the week after that i had the in-person interview.  the in-person interview took about 2.5 hours.  First I met with the technical team and had the questions about data analysis, then met with the people who would be my cohort, no really tough questions there.  finally met with the execs and the program manager.
Interview Questions: When/ how do you use Vlookup?

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was lengthy but thats the nature of HR in Higher education. I had to do a phone interview and then I was called back to do an in person interview with a large group of people. A round of questioning. and then I had to interview with the senior director 1 on 1.
Interview Questions: What would you contribute to this office?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the TU portal. After a week, I sent a follow-up email to the hiring manager but I did not get any response. Then, I decided to go and talk to the hiring manager in person. It was very helpful to see the workplace and staff. They emailed me after a few days for the interview and I got the job.
Interview Questions: About the availability, working hours, and wage.

title: Junior Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: very straightforward interview with supervisor and with the other members of ce system. You have to show your sample of code and should able to explain it to interviewers. It was very average interview and interviewers were very nice.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: The position was offered to me via email. One of the professors from the IT department had suggested me as a possible hire. The IT HR department contacted me and offered to set up an interview if I was interested. I was, and the interview date and time was completely up to me.
Interview Questions: What is your strongest attribute?

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied and received a phone interview within 1-2 weeks. Had an in person interview, followed by an additional interview. General interview questions. Hiring process took 2-3 weeks. First step was calling my references, followed by a background check and then finally a formal offer over the phone from HR.m
Interview Questions: Most difficult was presenting an idea for a campaign on the spot.

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty fair. The process was very exciting and I was excited about getting a new job in the big city.  When they called me back I was very excited. Part of the reason I was so excited was that they were a premiere university in a very vibrant city. It will be fun to work there and the students are very cool.
Interview Questions: What are your strongest qualifications?

title: Office Assistance Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: applied through school website,Applied through my school's career website. Everyone gets the same five questions in the interview and there's only one round. Questions are all behavioral, like describe a time you had to work with a team.
Interview Questions: what is your strength

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was just a CV submission with a statement of purpose. Then I have got a mail from the school saying that I have got the offer for a Ph.D., after a while, I have got an offer letter saying that I was funded for my phd.
Interview Questions: What have I done my high school?

title: Job Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Temple University in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Everything is structured.  First, you apply.  HR forwards your resume to the department if applicable.  Someone from the department will call you to set up an interview.  It was just a face to face interview.  No phone interview.  I met with a panel of 3 (Director, Assistant Director, and the Program Coordinator).  The questions were standard, tell me about yourself?  Why are you interested in this position? What can you bring to this position?

The entire process from applying online until hiring took about 3 months.
Interview Questions: There was not a most difficult or unexpected question.  The questions were standard.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: -Promotion (3 years ago); With the Dean's Office: involved several Deans and other advising representatives; Goal setting, vision of department requested; standard request to bring resumes for all involved; very formal despite familiarity.
Interview Questions: -Future initiatives/projects (what do I envision).

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, then someone from the office I applied to contacted me regarding the interview. I interviewed at the office with the hiring manager. The interview was short but pretty simple. They asked me why I was interested in the position, and whether I had any previous experience that would help me with this position.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very laid-back, mostly provided information rather than asking many questions.Basic interview questions were asked. Interviewer conducted interview in a timely manner (was on time and lasted average amount of time). Honestly a great place to work for a student, I definitely hated leaving.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a disgruntled guest?

title: Computer Lab Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: one interview process by 2 people
Interview Questions: do you have technical skills

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: I was hired by my advisor so i did not have an interview
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Clerk V Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions:
1st Interview: Phone interview with two people, one who would be supervisor and one who would have been on the same level
2nd Interview: All-day interview including lunch. Met with four different panels, all consisting of at least 5 people. Also met briefly with the director of the department
After the interview process, it took several weeks to get to an offer.
Interview Questions: What three values would you bring to the job to solve a problem?

title: Human Resource Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview, followed by several on campus interviews. Be prepared to wait for a response, even if you are told they intend to hire quickly. They send everything through an affirmative action review after ranking candidates for hire. This always delays things. 
Also, read any written offer carefully. Unless you are faculty you are considered an at-will employee.
Interview Questions: Why Temple?

title: Facility Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very relaxed. Quan King was the interviewer. He kept the interview very personable and allowed me to express myself. It was a very comfortable setting and was very informative.
Interview Questions: What are your biggest strengths and weaknesses?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: super basic interview questions. just be confident and know all the lifeguarding skills. also have experience with working in teams.
Interview Questions: I've recently started doing the interview process and some people seem to get caught up on explaining a conflict filled situation and how they resolved it.

title: Honors Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied, and shortly after, I was contacted for an interview by the person who would be my supervisor.  I was then interviewed by her, and the rest of the advising team, one of which was an applicant for the position I was vying for.  I don't think the process was completely fair.
Interview Questions: If you were an honors course, which course would you be?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Temple University
Interview Descriptions: not complicated or whatsoever. You have to be the right fit for the organization though.
Interview Questions: none

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: The original position for which I was hired was Assistant Director of Development but HR would not approve the position.  I was offered the position that was open for executive assistant while waiting for HR to create the ADD position.  Two months after accepting the lower position, there were two significant changes in leadership and the promise went unfilled.
Interview Questions: My interview was with an acting dean, the director of development, a associate dean and business manager.  The interview started off with random questions about my previous position and were not relevant to the position.  There seemed to be no plan for the interview.
