When the interviewers grew silent, I conducted a "self interview," using the job description to highlight my experience and skills.

title: Driver Helper Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview  process was quick, since I am a driver half was talking in the other half was driving.  I was questioned about my driving skills and where I received my commercial drivers license. Several of the questions were answered along with my filing of all IDs  I was given the driving test by the supervisor to which I had to display that I knew how to drive a stick shift truck, I only drove around corners and approximately a six blocks radius, the test was done and then I was told that they  would give me a call back and let me know whether not I have a job.
Interview Questions: Why do I want this job?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very long wait from application to interview. Questions were very easy, and didn't seem to apply much to the position. Was led to believe there were growth opportunities, which turned out to be untrue.
Interview Questions: What makes you unique?

title: PT Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I went in and the job duties were explained to me. I was also told what days and times they were looking to fill. I was asked about my previous experience and availability. I was given a little background information then asked if I was able to work independently and in a group setting. And i was also told I would not be working alone until I had finished training.
Interview Questions: Are you able to work well in both an independent and group setting?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview after submitting job application online. I met with the person I was going to work for directly. The interview was very informal and relaxed.
Interview Questions: How are your multitasking skills?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was intense. A day long worth of interviews along with a presentation was draining. I was able to meet a lot of the staff and the people I would be working with which was good.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions, questions about student development theory

title: Director, Facilities Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied on-line and attached my most current resume and a cover letter. I was familiar with the university and the department having previously worked there as a contractor. Initial and sole interview was a panel interview, and I was familiar the people on the panel. The hiring manager asked 95% of the questions, his team members asked one or two questions. Nothing very technical - mostly work history and experience questions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Technical Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, MO) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
1 Recruiter reviews application 
2. Recruiter phone interviews 
3. Assessment 
4. Hiring Manager interview 
5. Background checks 

After all of those process, I got passes and get a phone call from my boss. The process took around 3 weeks to go. Then I got a phone call from my boss.
Interview Questions: What's your career path?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Temple University in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Gave a talk about my previous laboratory research projects to the department. Talked to my prospective PI about planned scientific projects and roles. Talked about my career plans into the future in academia and scientific research in neuroscience. My prospective PI liked to give me a chalk talk format for discussing ideas.
Interview Questions: What are your proposed projects and career plans

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard interview. No need to think outside the box. Learn a bit about the university before your interview, but you really don't need to prepare much.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: The Interview process was Friendly and Brief. I met with three different professors and the PhD director. They asked about my experience as a researcher and as a teacher, and the conversation was very informal. Since I had all the qualifications they desired, including good recommendation letters, the process went very smoothly.
Interview Questions: What were my research interests

title: Student Life Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had  a few rounds of interviews  with different co-workers and supervisors. This was nothing unusual compared to most other schools. Included were meetings with the head of department and head of our division as well.
Interview Questions: Standard stuff: what do you see as challenges for students, what are your areas for growth, etc.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: They checked my info and then ask some typical questions such like why is this company? what's your we..
Interview Questions: what's your adv

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Temple University in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Although qualified for the position, HR did not forward my resume to the department and I never heard back. Six months later, seeing that the job was still posted, I emailed the director of the program and was invited to interview. She had to contact HR and demand that they send my resume. I was "hired" before they finally did so. The director confirmed that this was a recurring problem.
Interview Questions: The interview process was conversational, collegial and enjoyable. There was no "gotcha" questions.

title: Technical Support Specialist, Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Initial application submitted online. Called in for an interview and met with a manager who would turn out to be my boss. The questions were typical interview questions. Nothing technical. It should be noted that the interviewer is the person who has the position open, so there are many people interviewing and my experience reflected the style of my manager and may not be typical. Called in for a second interview with my manager's boss. Typical second interview. He just wanted to meet me and make sure I was okay.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Technical Support Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: The hiring managers treated me well but I did not get the job.
Interview Questions: What is DNS?

title: Financial Aid Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: They didn't ask a lot of questions but informed mostly about the position.  I think the director was out of town during the interviewing stage.They asked me about funding and what experience I have with federal aid
Interview Questions: They asked me about funding and what experience I have with federal aid

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Temple is a nice place to work. Like most academic institutions it can be slow with low turnover. The interview consisted of basic questions. Strengths, Weaknesses, what I can bring to the table etc.
Interview Questions: Descrivbe weaknesses you may have.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: Mostly demographic questions. Brief overview of job descriprtion. Outcome of hiring managers decision told after interview
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked in an administrative setting?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Phila, PA) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Quick first interview. Scheduled second interview with manager on same day.
Interview Questions: Qualification test about gen nursing knowledge and medications

title: Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Temple University in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was lengthy and I had to wait for 30 days to get a response form the school. The work environment seemed very busy when I walked in  a week prior I had been given my interview on the 31st day. I was contacted two weeks before my interview date.
Interview Questions: Your resume suggests that you may be over-qualified or too experienced for this position. What's Your opinion?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: The RA professor just asked about my research interests and what types of software I knew.
Interview Questions: What type of research are you interested in?

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Temple University (Philadelphia, PA) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: My last interview at this employer was actually in 2005. I had several interviews, but the last ones I had included interviews with 4 people (who are no longer in these positions. I interviewed with 2 people on the first day (Finance mgr, and direct supervisor) and a few days later was called back to meet with the Dean and his assistant.
Interview Questions: Please tell us about a time you encountered a conflict with your supervisor, including how you addressed and resolved it.
